short_summary: Drydocking and Refit for the Canadian Coast Guard Ship CCGS Vector
description: Trade Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement ; Tendering Procedures: All interested suppliers may submit a bid Competitive Procurement Strategy: Lowest/Lower Bid Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement: No Nature of Requirements ; The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) requires a contractor to carry out the drydocking and refit for the Canadian Coast Guard Ship (CCGS) Vector. The Work must be conducted in accordance with the associated Technical Specifications detailed in the Statement of Work; Inspections, Tests and Trials; and Project Management Services attached as Annexes A, D and E. Solicitation documents are available on the BuyAndSell.gc.ca/tenders web site. For specifications, drawings, annexes, and appendices associated with this solicitation, bidders must contact the Contracting Authority by e-mail at andre.godin3@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca. The sourcing strategy related to this procurement will be limited to suppliers in the Area of Origin of the vessel (Western Canada), in accordance with the PWGSC Supply Manual Article 3.170.10(b). This procurement is subject to CFTA and is exempt from NAFTA [see Chapter 10, Annex 1001.2b, paragraph 1 (a)] and from the WTO-AGP (see Annex 4). Work must commence and be completed as follows: Commence: Decemmber 7, 2022 Complete: March 24, 2023. By submitting a bid, the Bidder certifies that it has sufficient material and human resources allocated or available and that the above work period is adequate to both complete the known work and absorb a reasonable amount of unscheduled work. ePost Connect This bid solicitation allows bidders to use the epost Connect service provided by Canada Post Corporation to transmit their bid electronically. Bidders must refer to Part 2 entitled Bidder Instructions, and Part 3 entitled Bid Preparation Instructions, of the bid solicitation, for further information. Optional Bidders' Conference and Site Visit There is an optional bidders' conference and site visit associated with this requirement. Consult Part 2 - Bidder Instructions. Procurement Business Number Suppliers are required to have a Procurement Business Number (PBN) before contract award. tags: THE CANADIAN COAST GUARD SHIP CCNI VECTOR
full_summary:
---

**Government Tender Announcement**

**Tender Reference:** PW-_XLV-176-8401
**Tender Title:** CCGS Vector - Drydocking and Refit
**Solicitation Number:** F1782-22C037/A

**Published Date:** September 23, 2022
**Closing Date:** November 14, 2022 (5:00 pm EST)

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal
**Trade Agreement:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
**Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
**Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding

**Scope of Work:**

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada is seeking a contractor to perform drydocking and refit services for the Canadian Coast Guard Ship (CCGS) Vector. The work must be conducted in accordance with the Technical Specifications, Inspections, Tests and Trials, and Project Management Services outlined in the Statement of Work (Annex A, D, and E).

The contractor must be based in Western Canada, as per the Public Works and Government Services Canada Supply Manual Article 3.170.10(b). The procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement and is exempt from the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) and the World Trade Organization - Agreement on GovernmentProcurement (WTO-AGP).

**Work Schedule:**

The work must commence on December 7, 2022, and be completed by March 24, 2023.

**Electronic Submission:**

Bidders may submit their proposal electronically using the epost Connect service. For more information, refer to Part 2 of the bid solicitation.

**Debriefing:**

Bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process within 15 working days of receipt of the results.

**Language:**

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

**Contracting Authority:**

Further information about this procurement can be obtained from:
Andre Godin
Public Works and Government Services Canada
Phone: (250) 216-2504
Email: andres.godin3@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca

---

Important Details:

* This procurement is limited to suppliers in the Western Canada region.
* The contract is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement.
* The procurement is exempt from the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) and the World Trade Organization - Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP).
* The work must be completed by March
